systemData.Description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

location.Description: The geo-location where the resource lives

managedBy.Description: The fully qualified resource ID of the resource that manages this resource. Indicates if this resource is managed by another Azure resource. If this is present, complete mode deployment will not delete the resource if it is removed from the template since it is managed by another resource.

kind.Description: Metadata used by portal/tooling/etc to render different UX experiences for resources of the same type; e.g. ApiApps are a kind of Microsoft.Web/sites type.  If supported, the resource provider must validate and persist this value.

etag.Description: The etag field is *not* required. If it is provided in the response body, it must also be provided as a header per the normal etag convention.  Entity tags are used for comparing two or more entities from the same requested resource. HTTP/1.1 uses entity tags in the etag (section 14.19), If-Match (section 14.24), If-None-Match (section 14.26), and If-Range (section 14.27) header fields.

createdBy.Description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.Description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.Description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.Description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedAt.Description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

publicNetworkAccess.Description: Enabled allows this resource to be accessed from both public and private networks, Disabled allows this resource to only be accessed via private endpoints

principalId.Description: The principal ID of resource identity.

name.Description: The name of the SKU. Ex - P3. It is typically a letter+number code

tier.Description: This field is required to be implemented by the Resource Provider if the service has more than one tier, but is not required on a PUT.

size.Description: The SKU size. When the name field is the combination of tier and some other value, this would be the standalone code.

family.Description: If the service has different generations of hardware, for the same SKU, then that can be captured here.

capacity.Description: If the SKU supports scale out/in then the capacity integer should be included. If scale out/in is not possible for the resource this may be omitted.

name.Description: A user defined name of the 3rd Party Artifact that is being procured.

publisher.Description: The publisher of the 3rd Party Artifact that is being bought. E.g. NewRelic

product.Description: The 3rd Party artifact that is being procured. E.g. NewRelic. Product maps to the OfferID specified for the artifact at the time of Data Market onboarding.

promotionCode.Description: A publisher provided promotion code as provisioned in Data Market for the said product/artifact.

version.Description: The version of the desired product/artifact.

systemData.Description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

location.Description: The geo-location where the resource lives

managedBy.Description: The fully qualified resource ID of the resource that manages this resource. Indicates if this resource is managed by another Azure resource. If this is present, complete mode deployment will not delete the resource if it is removed from the template since it is managed by another resource.

kind.Description: Metadata used by portal/tooling/etc to render different UX experiences for resources of the same type; e.g. ApiApps are a kind of Microsoft.Web/sites type.  If supported, the resource provider must validate and persist this value.

etag.Description: The etag field is *not* required. If it is provided in the response body, it must also be provided as a header per the normal etag convention.  Entity tags are used for comparing two or more entities from the same requested resource. friendlyName.Description: User friendly name of scaling plan.

daysOfWeek.Description: Set of days of the week on which this schedule is active.

rampUpStartTime.Description: Starting time for ramp up period.

rampUpLoadBalancingAlgorithm.Description: Load balancing algorithm for ramp up period.

rampUpMinimumHostsPct.Description: Minimum host percentage for ramp up period.

rampUpCapacityThresholdPct.Description: Capacity threshold for ramp up period.

peakLoadBalancingAlgorithm.Description: Load balancing algorithm for ramp up period.

rampDownStartTime.Description: Starting time for ramp down period.

rampDownLoadBalancingAlgorithm.Description: Load balancing algorithm for ramp up period.

rampDownMinimumHostsPct.Description: Minimum host percentage for ramp down period.

rampDownCapacityThresholdPct.Description: Capacity threshold for ramp down period.

rampDownForceLogoffUsers.Description: Should users be logged off forcefully from hosts.

rampDownStopHostsWhen.Description: Specifies when to stop hosts during ramp down period.

rampDownWaitTimeMinutes.Description: Number of minutes to wait to stop hosts during ramp down period.

rampDownNotificationMessage.Description: Notification message for users during ramp down period.

offPeakLoadBalancingAlgorithm.Description: Load balancing algorithm for ramp up period.

scalingPlanEnabled.Description: Is the scaling plan enabled for this hostpool.

operation.Description: The type of operation for migration.

migrationPath.Description: The path to the legacy object to migrate.

systemData.Description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

filePath.Description: Specifies a path for the executable file for the application.

msixPackageFamilyName.Description: Specifies the package family name for MSIX applications

msixPackageApplicationId.Description: Specifies the package application Id for MSIX applications

commandLineSetting.Description: Specifies whether this published application can be launched with command line arguments provided by the client, command line arguments specified at publish time, or no command line arguments at all.

showInPortal.Description: Specifies whether to show the RemoteApp program in the RD Web Access server.

iconContent.Description: the icon a 64 bit string as a byte array.

systemData.Description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

location.Description: The geo-location where the resource lives

managedBy.Description: The fully qualified resource ID of the resource that manages this resource. Indicates if this resource is managed by another Azure resource. If this is present, complete mode deployment will not delete the resource if it is removed from the template since it is managed by another resource.

kind.Description: Metadata used by portal/tooling/etc to render different UX experiences for resources of the same type; e.g. ApiApps are a kind of Microsoft.Web/sites type.  If supported, the resource provider must validate and persist this value.

etag.Description: The etag field is *not* required. If it is provided in the response body, it must also be provided as a header per the normal etag convention.  Entity tags are used for comparing two or more entities from the same requested resource. HTTP/1.1 uses entity tags in the etag (section 14.19), If-Match (section 14.24), If-None-Match (section 14.26), and If-Range (section 14.27) header fields.

maxSessionLimit.Description: The max session limit of HostPool.

loadBalancerType.Description: The type of the load balancer.

vmTemplate.Description: VM template for sessionhosts configuration within hostpool.

ssoadfsAuthority.Description: URL to customer ADFS server for signing WVD SSO certificates.

ssoClientId.Description: ClientId for the registered Relying Party used to issue WVD SSO certificates.

ssoClientSecretKeyVaultPath.Description: Path to Azure KeyVault storing the secret used for communication to ADFS.

ssoSecretType.Description: The type of single sign on Secret Type.

preferredAppGroupType.Description: The type of preferred application group type, default to Desktop Application Group

startVMOnConnect.Description: The flag to turn on/off StartVMOnConnect feature.

publicNetworkAccess.Description: Enabled allows this resource to be accessed from both public and private networks, Disabled allows this resource to only be accessed via private endpoints

sessionHostComponentUpdateConfiguration.Description: The session host configuration for updating agent, monitoring agent, and stack component.

token.Description: The registration token base64 encoded string.

registrationTokenOperation.Description: The type of resetting the token.

maintenanceType.Description: The type of maintenance for session host components.

useSessionHostLocalTime.Description: Whether to use localTime of the virtual machine.

maintenanceWindowTimeZone.Description: Time zone for maintenance as defined in https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.timezoneinfo.findsystemtimezonebyid?view=net-5.0. Must be set if useLocalTime is true.

primaryWindow.Description: Maintenance window starting hour and day of week.

secondaryWindow.Description: Secondary maintenance windows is a list of days at one specific hour. Maintenance windows are 2 hours long. We try to exercise this only when the primary window update fails.

hour.Description: The update start hour of the day. (0 - 23)
The update start hour of the day. (0 - 23)

daysOfWeek.Description: Set of days of the week on which this schedule is active.

systemData.Description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

version.Description: The time when session host configuration was last modified and something was changed.

vMSizeId.Description: The id of the size of a virtual machine connected to a hostpool.

diskType.Description: The disk type used by virtual machine in hostpool session host.

vmCustomConfigurationUri.Description: The uri to the storage blob containing scripts to be run on the virtual machine after provisioning.

imageInfo.Description: Image configurations of session host in a HostPool.

type.Description: The type of image session hosts use in the hostpool.

storageBlobUri.Description: The uri to the storage blob which contains the VHD. Image type must be StorageBlob.

customId.Description: The resource id of the custom image or shared image. Image type must be CustomImage.

exactVersion.Description: The exact version of the image.

name.Description: The domain a virtual machine connected to a hostpool will join.

joinType.Description: The type of domain join done by the virtual machine.

mdmProviderGuid.Description: The MDM Provider GUID used during MDM enrollment for Azure AD joined virtual machines.

credentials.Description: Credentials needed to create the virtual machine.

userName.Description: The user name to the account.

passwordKeyVaultResourceId.Description: The keyvault resource id to the keyvault secrets.

passwordSecretName.Description: The keyvault secret name the password is stored in.

systemData.Description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

imagePath.Description: VHD/CIM image path on Network Share.

packageFamilyName.Description: Package Family Name from appxmanifest.xml. Contains Package Name and Publisher name.

displayName.Description: User friendly Name to be displayed in the portal.

packageRelativePath.Description: Relative Path to the package inside the image.

isRegularRegistration.Description: Specifies how to register Package in feed.

isActive.Description: Make this version of the package the active one across the hostpool.

version.Description: Package Version found in the appxmanifest.xml.

lastUpdated.Description: Date Package was last updated, found in the appxmanifest.xml.

appId.Description: Package Application Id, found in appxmanifest.xml.

appUserModelID.Description: Used to activate Package Application. Consists of Package Name and ApplicationID. Found in appxmanifest.xml.

rawIcon.Description: the icon a 64 bit string as a byte array.

rawPng.Description: the icon a 64 bit string as a byte array.

systemData.Description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

privateLinkServiceConnectionState.Description: A collection of information about the state of the connection between service consumer and provider.

id.Description: The ARM identifier for Private Endpoint

description.Description: The reason for approval/rejection of the connection.

actionsRequired.Description: A message indicating if changes on the service provider require any updates on the consumer.

systemData.Description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.
